title: Prohibitions on Restrictions to Assignment of Receivables
text:
Prohibitions on Restrictions to Assignment of Receivables more+ <iframe src="http://www.jdsupra.com/post/contentViewerEmbed.aspx?fid=6ea6eb3c-5f09-4b0b-902f-841cce1d165d" width="100%" height="620" frameborder="1" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; overflow-x:hidden !important; overflow:hidden;" scrolling="auto"> 

Certain provisions of the (the “ Act ”) came into force on 26 May 2015, section 1 grants powers to the Secretary of State to enact regulations for the purpose of securing that any non-assignment of receivables term of a relevant contract (a) has no effect; (b) has no effect in relation to persons of a prescribed description; or (c) has effect in relation to persons of a prescribed description only for such purposes as may be prescribed. A “relevant contract” includes contracts for goods, services or intangible assets but which are not “excluded financial services contracts” 
“Financial services contracts” 

In the government’ 

Revised draft regulations are anticipated after Parliament returns from its summer recess and BIS issued a press release on 10 August 2015, indicating that a ‘ban on anti-invoice finance terms in contracts’ would take effect ‘early next year’
